sesemi.models.heads package¶

Submodules¶

sesemi.models.heads.loss module¶

Loss heads.

class sesemi.models.heads.loss.LossHead(logger: Optional[pytorch_lightning.loggers.base.LightningLoggerBase] = None)¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

The interface for loss heads.

logger¶

An optional PyTorch Lightning logger.

build(backbones: Dict[str, sesemi.models.backbones.base.Backbone])¶

Builds the loss head.

Parameters

backbones – A dictionary of shared backbones. During the build, new backbones can be added. As this is actually an nn.ModuleDict which tracks the parameters, these new backbones should not be saved to the loss head object to avoid double-tracking.

forward(data: Dict[str, Any], backbones: Dict[str, sesemi.models.backbones.base.Backbone], features: Dict[str, Any], step: int, **kwargs) → torch.Tensor¶

Computes the loss.

Parameters

  • data – A dictionary of data batches.

  • backbones – A dictionary of shared backbones. This should not be altered.

  • features – A dictionary of shared features. Additional tensors can be added to this.

  • step – The training step number.

  • **kwargs – Placeholder for other arguments that may be added.

training: bool¶
class sesemi.models.heads.loss.RotationPredictionLossHead(input_data: str = 'rotation_prediction', input_backbone: str = 'backbone', logger: Optional[pytorch_lightning.loggers.base.LightningLoggerBase] = None)¶

Bases: sesemi.models.heads.loss.LossHead

The rotation prediction loss head.

build(backbones: Dict[str, sesemi.models.backbones.base.Backbone])¶

Builds the loss head.

Parameters

backbones – A dictionary of shared backbones. During the build, new backbones can be added. As this is actually an nn.ModuleDict which tracks the parameters, these new backbones should not be saved to the loss head object to avoid double-tracking.

forward(data: Dict[str, Any], backbones: Dict[str, sesemi.models.backbones.base.Backbone], features: Dict[str, Any], step: int, **kwargs) → torch.Tensor¶

Computes the loss.

Parameters

  • data – A dictionary of data batches.

  • backbones – A dictionary of shared backbones. This should not be altered.

  • features – A dictionary of shared features. Additional tensors can be added to this.

  • step – The training step number.

  • **kwargs – Placeholder for other arguments that may be added.

training: bool¶

Head models.
